message: The SO post shows what I've tried so far, which continues to have validation issues. I think django is validating "optiona,other" against the value of the 'choices' argument to the field.
I need to implement a form widget that represents a CharField on a form as a set of checkboxes plus an "other" field. I've written up an SO post about it:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/6743022/implementing-a-multiple-checkbox-select-other-widget-in-django
ideally I'd like to store the value in the db as a CharField, like "option1,option3,other". The "other" value will be a separate field.
and heres the SplitDateTimeWidget: http://goo.gl/0fs8U  - it's a good example of how to create a widget that's got two input elements.
Unless you change the validation logic (or dynamically change what's in your field's "choices"), you'll continue to get validation errors.
I posted an answer for you. Vote up or select if it helps. (I'm sooo close to being able to comment)
@emperorcezar -- I think you've given me an idea... if it works out I'll accept your response. :-)
Yep, that's exactly what's happening.
thanks guys!

Here's what I'd do:  Create a subclass of forms.ChoiceField, and override it's clean method.  You can then check to see if the "other" choice was selected, and then do whatever validation you want -- or none at all.
rereading your SO post makes me realize my earlier comment doesn't make much sense! ;)
@steveivy Yeah, I dont' really spend enough time customizing forms...

I see you're already overriding MultipleChoiceField... here's something you might consider:  Since you've essentially got a Field with 2 widgets, you might consider doing something like the SplitDateTimeField: http://goo.gl/luhEt
@bkmontgomery it's ok! this stuff is confusing sometimes.
you'd have your multi-select widget that validates as usually, and then you could add in another widget for your "other" input.
ok, so @emperorcezar @bkmontgomery -- here's where I stand: I implemented clean(), validate(), and valid_value() on my field subclass, but something is still invalidating the input.
https://gist.github.com/3327b22ecdc0f8abca8f
how do I shortcut any other validations on that field?
OK: turns out the model was validating agains the choices= list on the field def. Removing the choices arg to the model field definition fixed it.
